SourceProxy.name: AtmosphereVolumize
SourceProxy.label: Atmosphere Volumize
SourceProxy.Documentation:
Convert stacked 2D quad layers into 3D hexahedral cells.
This filter takes the 3D output from AtmosphereReader3D (Port 1 or Port 2) which consists of stacked 2D quad layers at each vertical level, and converts them into true 3D hexahedral (brick) cells. This enables proper volume rendering and 3D visualization of atmospheric data.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: Input must be vtkUnstructuredGrid from AtmosphereReader3D 3D output.

SourceProxy.name: AtmosphereExtractSlices
SourceProxy.label: Atmosphere Extract Slices
SourceProxy.Documentation:
Extract a contiguous range of vertical slices from 3D atmosphere data.
This filter extracts a subset of vertical levels from 3D atmosphere output, useful for focusing on specific atmospheric regions such as the troposphere, stratosphere, or boundary layer without processing the entire vertical column.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: Input must be vtkUnstructuredGrid from AtmosphereReader3D 3D output.

IntVectorProperty.name: MinMaxPlanes
IntVectorProperty.label: Planes (Min - Max)
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Select the range of vertical planes to extract (inclusive).

SourceProxy.name: AtmosphereSphere
SourceProxy.label: Atmosphere Sphere
SourceProxy.Documentation:
Project lat/lon data onto a 3D sphere for globe visualization.
This filter transforms points from geographic coordinates (longitude as X, latitude as Y, vertical level as Z) into spherical coordinates for rendering data on a 3D globe. It supports vertical exaggeration through a scale factor to make atmospheric layers visible.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: Input mesh with points in geographic coordinates.

IntVectorProperty.name: Data Layer
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: If enabled, adds a small offset to prevent z-fighting when overlaying data.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Scale
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Vertical exaggeration factor. Higher values make vertical structure more visible.
